form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for permanent full expensing for property used to capture gas that would otherwise be flared or vented and to use such gas in value-added products.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Facilitating Lower Atmospheric Released Emissions Act or the FLARE Act.

section.header: Permanent full expensing of costs related to flaring and venting mitigation systems

subsection.text: Section 168(k) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Permanent expensing of costs related to flaring and venting mitigation systems

subparagraph.text: In the case of any applicable energy property—

clause.text: the applicable percentage shall be 100 percent.

For purposes of this paragraph, the term applicable energy property means any qualified property (as determined as if clause (iii) of paragraph (2)(A) did not apply with respect to such property) which is a flaring and venting mitigation system.
For purposes of this subparagraph, the term flaring and venting mitigation system means a system which—

subclause.text: separates, collects, utilizes, or combusts methane and heavier hydrocarbons by—

item.text: compressing or liquefying gas for use as fuel or transport to a processing facility,
conversion to electricity for electricity-driven activities or supply to the electrical grid,

clause.text: This paragraph shall not apply to any property placed in service by any foreign entity of concern.
In this paragraph, the term foreign entity of concern has the meaning given that term in section 10612(a) of the Research and Development, Competition, and Innovation Act (42 U.S.C. 19221(a)).

subsection.text: Section 168(k)(6)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting or paragraph (11) after this paragraph.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2025.
